verses.text_plain: I waited patiently for the Lord; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
verses.verse_html:
1I waited patiently for the Lord; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry. ▼
▼ I waited…: Heb. In waiting I waited

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I waited…: Heb. In waiting I waited
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I waited…: Heb. In waiting I waited

verses.text_plain: He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.
verses.verse_html:
2He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings. ▼
▼ an…: Heb. a pit of noise

footnotes.body_text: ▼ an…: Heb. a pit of noise
footnotes.body_html: ▼ an…: Heb. a pit of noise

verses.text_plain: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God: many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 3And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God: many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the Lord.

verses.text_plain: Blessed is that man that maketh the Lord his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
verses.verse_html: 4Blessed is that man that maketh the Lord his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

verses.text_plain: Many, O Lord my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.
verses.verse_html:
5Many, O Lord my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered. ▼
▼ they cannot…: or, none can order them unto thee

tokens.text: to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order

footnotes.body_text: ▼ they cannot…: or, none can order them unto thee
footnotes.body_html: ▼ they cannot…: or, none can order them unto thee

verses.text_plain: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.
verses.verse_html:
6Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required. ▼
▼ opened: Heb. digged

verses.text_plain: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,
verses.verse_html: 7Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,

verses.text_plain: I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
verses.verse_html:
8I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart. ▼
▼ within…: Heb. in the midst of my bowels

footnotes.body_text: ▼ within…: Heb. in the midst of my bowels
footnotes.body_html: ▼ within…: Heb. in the midst of my bowels

verses.text_plain: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O Lord, thou knowest.
verses.verse_html: 9I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O Lord, thou knowest.

verses.text_plain: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.
verses.verse_html: 10I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.

verses.text_plain: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Lord: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.
verses.verse_html: 11Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Lord: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.

verses.text_plain: For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.
verses.verse_html:
12For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me. ▼
▼ faileth: Heb. forsaketh

tokens.text: upon me, so that I am not able

verses.text_plain: Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me: O Lord, make haste to help me.
verses.verse_html: 13Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me: O Lord, make haste to help me.

verses.text_plain: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.
verses.verse_html: 14Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.

verses.text_plain: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.
verses.verse_html: 15Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.

verses.text_plain: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The Lord be magnified.
verses.verse_html: 16Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The Lord be magnified.

tokens.text: in thee: let such as love

verses.text_plain: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.
verses.verse_html: 17But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.
